wikipedia_page.main: John Trevanion Purnell Bettesworth-Trevanion (born Bettesworth; 1780 – 8 March 1840) was a Cornish politician.  He rebuilt Caerhays as a Gothic-style castle.

link_mentions.page: List of Old Etonians born in the 18th century

response: With the death of William Trevanion in 1767, the estate passed to his sister's son, John Bettesworth. John's son, John Bettesworth-Trevanion, built the present castle on a site close to the former manor house between 1807 and 1810; his architect was the Anglo-Welsh John Nash.Pevsner, N. (1970) Cornwall; 2nd ed. Penguin; p. 192 The castle was built close to the site of the original ancient home that had itself undergone expansion during the reign of King Henry VIII.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1806 United Kingdom general election
response: | Sir Christopher Hawkins  Replaced by John Bettesworth-Trevanion 1807
